thread.title: 6 Classic Restaurants In Minnesota With Prime Rib Locals Can't Get Enough Of
thread.title_full: 6 Classic Restaurants In Minnesota With Prime Rib Locals Can't Get Enough Of

author: Katherine Hall
title: 6 Classic Restaurants In Minnesota With Prime Rib Locals Can't Get Enough Of
text:
Craving mouthwatering prime rib in Minnesota that locals line up for weekend after weekend?
These 6 restaurants serve up tender, juicy prime rib that will have you dreaming about your next visit!
1. Lonesome Pine Restaurant & Bar (Deerwood)
Nestled among the beautiful lakes of Deerwood, Lonesome Pine Restaurant looks like a cozy cabin in the woods.
The rustic wooden exterior with green trim blends perfectly with the Minnesota landscape.
But this hidden gem is actually a prime rib paradise!
Walk inside and you’ll discover a warm, welcoming atmosphere that feels like dining at a friend’s lake house.
Large windows surround the dining area, offering gorgeous views while you enjoy your meal.
Their prime rib has reached legendary status in the area, and you’ll understand why with your first bite.
Each cut is impressively large, often hanging over the edges of the plate in the most delightful way.
The meat is seasoned with a perfect touch – enough to enhance the flavor without masking the natural beef taste.
What makes their prime rib extraordinary is the ideal balance of fat and lean meat.
Every bite melts in your mouth, releasing that rich, beefy flavor that prime rib enthusiasts crave.
The herb-crusted exterior adds another wonderful layer of flavor to each slice.
Weekends bring in crowds of hungry diners who know exactly what they’re coming for.
The friendly staff treats you like family, whether it’s your first visit or your fiftieth.
This lakeside treasure might require a bit of a drive, but the prime rib waiting at the end of your journey makes every mile worthwhile!
The charming porch wrapping around the building offers a perfect spot to enjoy a drink in summer.
Twinkling string lights create a magical atmosphere as darkness falls.
After a day of fishing or boating on the nearby lake, there’s nothing better than ending with Lonesome Pine’s famous prime rib.
Where: 13726 Katrine Dr, Deerwood, MN 56444
2. Jax Cafe (Minneapolis)
Hidden in Northeast Minneapolis, Jax Cafe has a classic, old-world charm from the moment you spot it.
The stone building with green awnings and hanging flower baskets looks like it belongs in another era.
This neighborhood institution serves some of the most talked-about prime rib in the Twin Cities.
Step inside and you’ll find a dining room with timeless appeal – wood paneling, comfortable seating, and an atmosphere of relaxed elegance.
It’s the kind of place where memories are made over amazing meals.
Their prime rib is a masterpiece of simplicity and flavor.
Each slice arrives with a perfectly pink center surrounded by a well-seasoned crust that seals in all the juices.
The meat is so tender you’ll barely need to use your knife.
What makes Jax’s prime rib special is their patient cooking method.
They slow-roast each cut for hours, allowing the flavors to develop naturally and the meat to reach that perfect tenderness.
Every serving comes with rich au jus that adds even more beefy goodness to each bite.
The classic sides that accompany the prime rib are chosen to complement, not compete with, the star of the show.
Many loyal customers have been coming back for years, making Jax part of their family traditions.
You might find yourself planning your return visit before you’ve even finished your meal!
The restaurant occupies a corner location with large windows that fill the space with natural light during day visits.
The historic brick building has become a beloved landmark in the neighborhood.
Meat lovers from across the Twin Cities make special trips just for a taste of Jax’s prime rib.
Where: 1928 University Ave NE, Minneapolis, MN 55418
3. Stockyards Tavern & Chophouse (South St Paul)
With a name like “Stockyards,” you know this place takes its beef seriously!
The simple tan building with its distinctive bull logo gives you a hint of the meaty treasures waiting inside.
This no-frills spot honors South St. Paul’s rich history in the meat industry.
Inside, you’ll discover a comfortable dining space with a classic steakhouse feel that’s welcoming rather than fancy.
Related: The Home-Cooked Meals at this Minnesota Diner are so Good, You’ll Dream about Them for Weeks
Related: Relish in the Nostalgia at this Iconic Long-Running Restaurant in Minnesota
Their prime rib is what beef dreams are made of.
Each slice is thick, juicy, and cooked to that beautiful pink perfection that prime rib should have.
The excellent marbling throughout the meat ensures flavor in every single bite.
What sets their prime rib apart is their special seasoning blend.
It creates a delicious crust on the outside while allowing the natural beef flavor to shine through.
Every serving comes with creamy horseradish sauce that adds just the right amount of zing.
You can choose your preferred doneness, but medium-rare really showcases the quality of their beef.
The portions are generous enough to satisfy even the heartiest appetite!
Though the restaurant might look ordinary from the outside, the prime rib experience is extraordinary.
This is serious comfort food served in a place where quality meat is the top priority.
The cozy bar area provides a perfect spot for a pre-dinner drink or catching the game.
Their weekend prime rib special has developed a devoted following among local meat enthusiasts.
The horseshoe logo displayed prominently above the entrance pays tribute to the area’s livestock heritage.
Where: 456 Concord Exchange S, South St Paul, MN 55075
4. Wiederholt’s Supper Club (Hastings)
Wiederholt’s looks like a blast from the past, and that’s a big part of its charm!
The wooden exterior with the classic “Supper Club” sign might make you feel like you’ve stepped back in time.
This place embraces old-school dining in all the right ways.
Inside, you’ll find a traditional supper club setting that feels wonderfully nostalgic.
The dining area is comfortable and unpretentious – exactly what you want in a restaurant focused on great food.
Their prime rib has earned a loyal following who return again and again.
Each cut is generous and beautifully marbled, with that perfect pink center that prime rib should have.
The meat is seasoned with a simple but effective blend that enhances its natural flavors.
What makes their prime rib exceptional is its incredible tenderness – it practically dissolves in your mouth.
The rich au jus served alongside adds even more depth to the beefy flavor.
Their horseradish sauce provides a perfect tangy contrast to the rich meat.
Weekend prime rib specials draw crowds of hungry diners who know they’re in for a treat.
The friendly, attentive service makes the whole experience even more enjoyable.
This is the kind of place where you’ll want to slow down, savor your meal, and maybe save room for one of their classic desserts.
Wiederholt’s proves that sometimes the most unassuming restaurants serve the most unforgettable meals!
The cocktail selection features timeless drinks that pair wonderfully with their hearty prime rib.
Local memorabilia decorates the wood-paneled walls, telling stories of the area’s history.
The parking lot fills quickly on weekend evenings – always a good sign that something delicious awaits inside.
Where: 14535 240th St E, Hastings, MN 55033
5. Twin City Grill (Bloomington)
Finding amazing prime rib in a shopping mall might seem surprising, but Twin City Grill breaks all expectations!
Located in the Mall of America, this restaurant stands out with its classic storefront featuring warm wood and glass details.
Step inside and the busy mall atmosphere disappears completely.
The interior offers a warm, sophisticated environment with comfortable seating and gentle lighting.
It’s the perfect escape from the hustle and bustle just outside its doors.
Their prime rib is a hidden treasure that many shoppers never discover.
Each cut is impressive – thick, juicy, and cooked to that perfect pink doneness that prime rib lovers seek.
The meat gets its wonderful flavor from their special seasoning blend and patient slow-roasting process.
What makes their prime rib remarkable is its consistency – it’s always tender, always flavorful, and always satisfying.
The rich au jus served alongside enhances the natural beef flavor beautifully.
Their creamy horseradish sauce adds a pleasant kick that balances the richness of the meat.
Classic sides accompany the prime rib, chosen to complement rather than overshadow the main attraction.
After hours of shopping, sitting down to a perfect prime rib dinner feels like the ultimate reward.
The attentive service and comfortable atmosphere elevate the entire dining experience.
Who would have thought one of Minnesota’s best prime rib dinners would be hiding in the state’s biggest mall?
Minnesota-themed décor throughout the restaurant gives it a local feel despite being in a tourist destination.
The bar offers an excellent selection of local beers that pair wonderfully with their rich prime rib.
Making reservations is recommended, especially during busy weekend shopping days.
Where: 130 North Garden 1ST FLOOR, Bloomington, MN 55425
6. Dehn’s Country Manor (Maple Grove)
From the road, Dehn’s Country Manor looks like a simple roadside restaurant you might pass without a second glance.
The modest stone and stucco building doesn’t hint at the prime rib perfection waiting for you inside.
This unassuming spot has earned its place in the hearts of local diners!
The interior welcomes you with a comfortable, homey atmosphere that invites you to relax and enjoy your meal.
Nothing fancy here – just a focus on good food and friendly service.
Their prime rib has become legendary among Minnesota meat lovers.
Each cut is impressive – thick, juicy, and cooked to that perfect pink center that makes prime rib special.
The meat is seasoned with care, enhancing the natural beef flavor without overwhelming it.
What makes their prime rib stand out is its remarkable consistency – it’s delicious every single time.
The rich au jus served alongside is perfect for dipping each flavorful bite.
Their horseradish sauce adds a zingy contrast that cuts through the richness of the meat.
Weekend prime rib specials attract crowds of regulars who know exactly what they’re coming for.
The portions are generous enough to satisfy even the biggest appetites!
This is comfort food at its finest, served in a place that feels like it could be your favorite neighborhood restaurant.
Dehn’s proves that sometimes the most unassuming places hide the most delicious surprises!
The restaurant sits amid well-maintained grounds that look especially beautiful during summer months.
Many loyal customers have been coming here for decades, sharing their love of Dehn’s prime rib with new generations.
The wonderful aroma of roasting beef fills the cozy dining room, making your mouth water the moment you walk in.
Where: 11281 Fernbrook Ln N, Maple Grove, MN 55369
These Minnesota restaurants might not look fancy from the outside, but they’re hiding beef treasures inside!
From lakeside cabins to mall surprises, these six spots serve prime rib so good you’ll be planning your next visit before the plates are cleared.
